DOC.brief_summary: This research is being done to compare pain relief and efficacy of trigger finger injection using a combination of lidocaine/corticosteroid versus corticosteroid injection alone versus corticosteroid/saline combination.
DOC.brief_title: Pain With Trigger Finger Injection: A Comparison of Steroid Alone Versus Steroid/Lidocaine Mixture
DOC.detailed_description: This is a prospective, randomized study comparing pain relief and efficacy of trigger finger injection using a combination of lidocaine/corticosteroid versus corticosteroid injection alone versus corticosteroid/saline combination.
DOC.criteria: Age 1890 Male or female (nonpregnant) Clinically diagnosed trigger digit Subject is able to provide voluntary, written informed consent Subject, in the opinion of the clinical investigator, is able to understand the clinical investigation and is willing to perform all study procedures and followup visits. Age <18 or >90 Pregnant or lactating women NonEnglish speaking individuals Medication contradictions to lidocaine, corticosteroids and/or saline Prior injection or surgery on the affected finger Diagnosis of reflex symptomatic dystrophy (RSD) or complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS) Open wound
